metadata.feature_description: Award points for wiki activities like creating articles, commenting, and interactions

steps.action: Navigated to user profile page (Activity Feed)
steps.expected: Points should be displayed on the user profile
steps.actual: Points displayed prominently showing '189' in the profile header

steps.expected: Top Contributors leaderboard should be visible
steps.actual: Top Contributors widget displayed showing ranked users (Test User123, Test User10, Test Admin, etc.)

steps.action: Recorded initial points (189) before creating article
steps.expected: Points should be recorded for comparison
steps.actual: Initial points: 189 displayed in Wiki sidebar

steps.action: Created new wiki article 'Scoring Test Article - Jan 2026' with content and tag
steps.expected: Article should be created and points should increase by 5 (per code configuration)

steps.action: Verified points after article creation on user profile
steps.expected: Points should increase from 189 to 194 (5 points for CreatedArticle)
steps.actual: Points increased to 194, confirming 5 points were awarded for creating article

observations: Code review of Mechanics.cs shows scoring definitions: CreatedArticle awards 5 rep/5 exp points, EditedArticle awards 1 rep/1 exp point
Most other actions (bookmarking, viewing, subscribing, flagging) award 0 points by default
Negative points are assigned for deleted articles (-5) and flagged articles (-1) to the original author
The 'Top Contributors' leaderboard on Community page serves as the gamification leaderboard
Points are displayed in multiple locations: User Profile header, Wiki sidebar, and profile widgets
